channel.title: procrastination on Aravind Reddy

item.title: Computer Networks
item.description: I’m reading a book on Computer Networks right now for a course and I feel awesome getting to know about tonnes of stuff which I’ve been using throughout my life ðŸ˜„

item.title: Randomness for Decisions
item.description: I was in a dilemma today whether I should study for the Machine Learning course or whether I should study for the Coherence & Quantum Entanglement course in the next three hours. I was totally unable to choose between them and so a lot of my brain’s computational power was being sucked up by this decision task. I finally decided to go with Octave’s random number generator. Just used unidrnd(2) ðŸ˜„

item.title: Ugly Duckling theorem
item.description: Yes, I know, my last post said that I would be shifting my blog from wordpress to a Jekyll Hugo based blog hosted with Github pages. But I’m procrastinating. Anyway, putting that aside, let’s get to the meat of the post. Check out the Ugly duckling theorem. It’s pretty dope. I encountered it in the introductory lecture slides for the course on Machine Learning I’m doing right now(yikes! ML ooh).
